Metadata: An in-vitro analysis of egg mortality in "Cancer anthonyi": the role of symbionts and temperature

A multifactorial experimental design was used to determine the relative contributions in-vitro of each of three common symbionts ("Carcinonemertâ€‹es epialti, Lagenidium callinectes", and "Leucothrix" sp.) to the egg mortality of the crab, "Cancer anthonyi" ("C. anthonyi" was used as it is abundant in California and breeds year-round). The susceptibility of eggs in different developmental stages was also examined. In addition, the effect of temperature on egg mortality and development, and on symbiont behavior, was investigated.
